Title: Research on & choose a CSS framework for building all your mockups
Description:
** Why is this important? **
Choose one CSS framework that you will consistently use for the entirety of the project. This will be used to construct dumb Mockups for demonstration of Backend functionality & eventually in implementing the Frontend.

Title: Link Pivotal Tracker with Slack
Description:
** Why this is important ** 
When there is activity on Pivotal tracker, updates automatically show up in a dedicated Slack channel (separate from the team channel).

Title: Link Github with Slack
Description:
** Why this is important **
When there is activity on Github, they automatically show up as updates in a dedicated Slack channel (separate from the normal team channel, same as the one used for the pivotal updates)

LABELS

Title: Link Pivotal Tracker with Github
Description:
** Why this is important **
When PRs are made, they automatically show up as comments/commit with their associated stories, giving more context to the story.

Title: Integrate TravisCI with readme badge
Description:
** Why is this important? ** 
This is required to automatically run tests and other preliminary build steps required to ship the next iteration of the product

Title: Configure Authors Haven to use PostgreSQL as DB Engine
Description:
**Why is this Important?** 
Authors Haven comes with support for MONGODB, a NoSQL Database. PostgreSQL  is an Open Source, fully featured and optimized SQL database engine for production ready environments. Give it a shot!

Title: Users should receive a JWT on Successful Registration
Description:
**Why**
Users once registered via the registration endpoint, should receive a JWT to be required on all subsequent calls to all other endpoints that require authentication.
 
**Acceptance Criteria**

**GIVEN** user successfully signs up/registers or logs in
**WHEN** user passes appropriate JSON object to the register and or login endpoint
**THEN** user should receive a JWT as the response

DEV NOTES
The app should no longer use sessions, but should use the newly implemented JWT strategy for authentication.
Passwords **MUST** be encrypted.

Title: Users should receive descriptive signup/Registration validation errors
Description:
Users should receive a descriptive error message when they enter invalid user parameters in an attempt to signup.

Invalid user parameters includes:

existing user email
invalid email
password of length less than 8
password not being alphanumeric

**Acceptance Criteria**
scenario 1
**GIVEN** user supplies invalid parameters for signup
**WHEN** user hits the signup button
**THEN** user should receive a descriptive error message telling the user why such details are not acceptable.

scenario 2
**GIVEN** user supplies a set of valid parameters for signup
**WHEN** user hits the signup button
**THEN** user should be successfully signed up.

Title: An Email should be sent to a user upon successful registration. User should be able to receive a verification link via email upon successful signup
Description:
**Why is this important?** 
Learning how to send emails using 3rd party API's is invaluable to a developer. Django also has an inbuilt Emailing system too!

_Acceptance Criteria_
GIVEN I sign up to the Authors Haven Application
WHEN submitted
THEN I should receive a verification email with a link to the application. 

**DEV NOTES**
Options include using sendGrid API for now to achieve the email verification feature.

Title: Users should be able to reset password reset via email
Description:
** Why is this important? **
Password reset functionality is missing in our application. Its invaluable in instances where our users forget their login credentials.

**Acceptance Criteria**
GIVEN I forget my password
WHEN I request for a reset
THEN I should receive an email with a reset link to the application.

**DEV NOTES**
Options include using sendGrid API for now to achieve the email verification feature.

Title: Enable Social Login via Google, Facebook and twitter
Description:
Currently a new user cannot login with their pre-existing social media accounts. He/She can only register and or login with email password combinations

Let's make it happen! Please not that implementation in this case means  **STRICTLY BACKEND** implementation only!

Title: Users should be able to create their profiles
Description:
**Why this is important**
Profiles will provide a way to maintain generic and  user specific data/info such as username, bio, contact info etc

**As a User**
I want to get my profile created once i register to the application.
I want my profile to display my **bio**, **image/avatar** and any other fields that the "**we**" the dev team deem necessary. Lets get **creative!**
I want to be able to **View** other users profiles , **Edit** my profile but i should **NOT** be able to edit another users profile

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario: 
Given User registers to be a member of Authors Haven. 
- Registration is done.
- User Profile is created. 
- A timestamp is associated to the profile

Title: Users should be able to create articles
Description:
**Why this is important**
Articles form the backbone of our application and introduces us to **CRUD** which is the building block of most web applications.

**As a User**
I want to be able to **CREATE** my articles and **READ/ACCESS** articles created by other authors. 
I want to be able to **ONLY** **UPDATE** and **DELETE** articles  that i have authored.


**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario:
An article should at minimum have a **title**, **body**, **description** and support for **images**. Lets not limit ourselves to this creativity is the way to go!
**Given**  two different users create articles of the same title, the app should generate unique **slugs** such that the articles don't create conflict.
**Article slugs** should be automatically added to articles if they do not exist .
**Timestamped** articles

Title: Users should be able to give a rating to an article
Description:
**Why this is important**
Our community as authors is built on trust. Rating each others articles helps to gain and build trust.Leaving a rating is your chance to give other authors a general idea of what we feel about their content

**As a User**
I want to be able to rate articles authored by others

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario:
Only authenticated users should be able to provide ratings

Title: Users should be able to comment on articles
Description:
**Why this is important**
Comments allow authors to get feedback on their articles.. We all love to know what people think about what we put out to the world......

**As a User**
I want to be able to make  a comment(s) on articles, both authored by me and those not authored by me.

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario:
Only authenticated users should be able to comments on articles.
Successive comments should be threaded
Timestamped comments.

Title: Users should be able to like and or dislike articles
Description:
**Why this is important**
Lets appreciate those authors who go out of their way to create good content with a Like(clap) and encourage those authors who do not meet our expectations with a dislike.

**As a User**
I want to be able to like or dislike articles  articles, both authored by me and those not authored by me.

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario:
Only **authenticated** users should be able to like or dislike articles.

Title: Users should be able to follow each other
Description:
**Why this is important**
We are a community of like minded authors/content creators. Lets keep tabs by following each other and by extension the articles we author.

**As a User**
I want to be able to follow and or unfollow other authors. 

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario 1:
Only **authenticated** users should be able to follow and or unfollow other users.

Scenario 2:
I need a view to manage those I follow and be able to see those who follow me

Title: Users should be able to receive notifications
Description:
**Why this is important**
Notifications give users to opportunity to know what they may have missed which may be important to them.

**As a User**
I want to be able to receive notifications when users I follow publish new articles.

I want to be able to receive notifications when articles I favorited have new interactions (like new comments).

I want to be able to opt in and out of these notifications.

**Developer Note**

There may be 2 types of notifications: email notifications and in-app notifications.

Email notifications are sent as email messages to the email address the user submitted during registration.
Users should be able to opt out (and in) of this type of notification.

In-app notifications show up in the app. This may be visible on a notification page or some other view, as the team may choose.
The team may choose to give users the ability to opt out of this type of notification.

Title: Users should be able to tag their articles
Description:
**Why this is important**
Tagging refers to the metadata that is assigned to a piece of content by the content creator and the readers/users of the content. Tagging allows for organization and or categorization of content

**As a User**
I want to be able to create tags for the  articles that I author. 

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario:
Only **authenticated** users should be able to tag articles .

Title: Pagination support for articles
Description: Pagination support is lacking for our articles. Reading can be a nightmare when we have so many articles. Lets get this done!

Title: Add Search Functionality with custom filters
Description:
**Why this is important**
Looking for article(s) in their dozens can be daunting. Would it be easier if we had a search functionality with custom filters? I bet it would.These filters avail the members to create a search criterion of their own which helps them to narrow it down if they don’t know the title exactly.

**As a User**
I want to be able to search for articles by author, article title and tag/keyword or search by filtering.

**Acceptance Criteria**
Scenario:
Any user (authenticated or not) should be able to search for articles on our platform .
